reviewText: This game looks like someones school project. Plays slow, non-responsive, repetative and simply boring.\n\nGame starts with shooting exactly the same astroids for a couple of minutes. I almost alt-f4 right then and there. However I read another review talking about a bossfight that would come after some timer in the top right corner elapsed. Fair enough some boring looking large ship emerged. Because of the length of the ship and the size of the boss shots its almost impossible to avoid some shots. But you cant tell that the shots hit you, only by looking at your health meter. After the boss more boring astroids came and another 3 minute timer... then its was alf-f4 time for real.
voteText: 17 of 23 people (74%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I was never one of those guys in the arcades back in the day ,i was too rubbish at this type of game.
Though i did try :)
The game is made on the Unity engine so graphics have a nice look to them ,simple but ok for this game.
A warning ,sort out your key-config in the box that pops up when you first boot up the game.
I was stuck the first time i played wondering why the ship wasn't firing and banging various keys on my keyboard.
Gameplay starts of easy enough  shooting asteroids that are rolling towards you ,it does seem to go on a bit long with the same rolling rocks" .
Just when i was getting slightly bored with it i noticed a timer in the top right corner counting down and sure enough the rocks stopped rolling and a huge "mothership" appeared from the side of the screen .
This where my previous arcade experiences came back to haunt me :)
I was dead in about 5 seconds .
Now
date:
someone more skilled at this type of game would probably relish the challenge .
You will get hit with waves of incoming "laser balls" and trying to overcome them is no easy task.
You have 2 weapons to start with(shooter+screen blitzer) and gain new weapons the more you progress so if you're up for it you might do better than i did.

It's cheap to buy and plays well
recommended: if your a fan of this genre then it's def. worth a look."
votesHelpful: 12 of 15 people (80%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
This is a fun side-scroll shooting game.
There are 2 different spaceships with different stats (more seems to be coming soon), 4 different weapons to select, a variety of astroids(which can flow around!) to shoot/dodge, and a bunch of boss battles, each with unique abilities!
The game has some decent graphics and good controls. It brings back memories of those old-school arcade games. Anyone likes this genre should absolutely give it a try!
voteText: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful

reviewText: A simple yet great game. While the game could use some instructions, it's mostly self-explanatory. The basics are very easy to learn and the early gameplay itself isn't too demanding for players new to the game and the genre, which allows them to learn the game fairly quickly. The game gets more challenging as you progress, but it retains the addictiveness and it leaves you wanting more.

reviewText: I played already in some shoot'em up games, so can say that Infinity Wings - Scout & Grunt is a good representative of the genre. In hangar we can see 2 ships (Scout and Grunt) with different stats (and there some mystery third ship, what will be available soon, as a free update I guess). Gameplay: first - you need destroy asteroids using various weapons for some time, you can see how much left in right top corner of screen; second - after time end, kill the boss. And about bugs: I found just one - you can't choice second ship using keyboard arrows, its just skip it. But with mouse all work good. Devs, fix it please. So Infinity Wings - Scout & Grunt is nice arcade game, what I can recommend.
voteText: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Infinity Wings - Scout & Grunt. I thought to scount and grunt would be my mission, but it's actually the names of the current playable ships, so that made me laugh. The horizontal shoot 'em up gameplay is quite standard and the graphics are pretty plain but somehow they're also pretty pretty, and I found myself clearing asteroids not just to avoid getting hit, but to see the pretty spacescapes. The in-game How to Play was kind of helpful, but it didn't mention that Keypad #" referred to the controls on a gamepad. I had to look at the pre-launch setup option window you get with most Unity games to see what the control scheme was. After I knew what my keys are
date: I was enjoying a moderately difficult shoot 'em up with my large and slow moving Grunt ship. The weapon variety is nice and I like how you can use ALL FOUR WEAPONS AT ONCE instead of having to choose between one based on powerups you pick up. The bosses were pretty tough and the shots were fast. But I wonder if when the bosses keep firing missles during their death animations... was that intentional? 10/10
recommended: would buy for the kids again."

reviewText: This is a nice retro 2d/3d shooter spaceships galactic game which basically is a jet shooting varied type of astroids in different positions comming at you while you dodging. I really enjoyed played because futuristic atmospheric remind me my childhood game days. Also the sound, the colours, interface, controls and grafics setting are friendly and great since my experience playing at. By his price looks fun for play hours. Recommended this game.
